Articles.Content:
When I came back from a solar orbit and try to land my probe, the terrain become a big blue dot and my craft exploded around 200 meters above sea level...

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=245979404

Can someone explain it and help me sort it out?

A very similar event happened in this thread.

Did you have a claw on your craft? Can you provide a picture of the craft?

Thanks
This happened to my flag once. It means you go under the surface of Kerbin to the core and then explode.

Looks like a kraken to me.

Did you try to restart your game?

(almost) the same just happened to me as well, coming down home the graphics did not change to higher resolution like it usually would, and approaching surface it was like 'landing' on Jool. My ship survived though. Oh and I did not have the claw and there are no mods whatsoever.

A very similar event happened in this thread.

Did you have a claw on your craft? Can you provide a picture of the craft?

Thanks

Well, just a simple probe with some science instruments and an ion engine

Thanks very much for helping me~

Did the same mission in http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/75324-Mysterious-Blue-Dot

Identical!!!

And the blue dot strikes me again!!!!

Though I survived...

On the way down

Landed in Ocean

Should I report to Squad or what should I do?><

Do you have any mods installed? Go into Settings, Graphics, and check to make sure that 'Fallback Shaders' = False. Fallback shaders is one of those options that if turned on can cause weird graphics problems.

That happened to me last night.

That doesn't answer any of my questions. Wait, why did you even bother to post this exact same thread again? There is no reason for this thread when you already have this one -> http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/75324-Mysterious-Blue-Dot

You shouldn't create multiple threads for the same issue.
Merged the threads, to keep the info in one spot.
That happened to me too, though i have visual enhancements installed, so instead of black and a blue dot, it was a blue dot with the clouds on the other side of Kerbin showing up.
Perhaps a fan of Carl Sagan decided to sneak some trojan code into the game to occasionally turn your homeworld into a mere blue dot.

Perhaps a fan of Carl Sagan decided to sneak some trojan code into the game to occasionally turn your homeworld into a mere blue dot.

Someone who desperately wanted to feel like the game had interstellar travel?

Someone who desperately wanted to feel like the game had interstellar travel?

The Pale Blue Dot I was trying to refer to obliquely was a photo taken from within the solar system. Nothing interstellar about it.
Seems like a Kraken attack. All kinds of weird things happen. I once had a duna lander ejected from the system at near the speed of light.

Seems like a Kraken attack. All kinds of weird things happen. I once had a duna lander ejected from the system at near the speed of light.

What is weird is that the kraken isn't ripping ships apart. The planet is quite simply disappearing, and the craft falls to the blue dot and crashes.

...

Perhaps if this happens again to someome, try to zoom way out and see if the ship has clipped into the terrain.
